title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 May 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:00 <+sburjan`> if you just want to play, download the jettty zip distribution, you won't have to configure a database  
00:00 <ries> you might be right…. I had issue uploading the xar yesterday, and decided to try the superadmin  
00:00 <ries> later it turned out this was a glassfish issue  
00:01 <ries> today I just logged in as superadmin to continue...  
00:01 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:01 <+sburjan`> yes, there is a issue with attachments on glassfish afaik  
00:01 <ries> but indeed, Admin / admin worked… but not before the XAR was imported  
00:01 <+sburjan`> Admin is more than enought to do all you want with XWiki :)  
00:01 <ries> this seems to be very powerfull..  
00:02 <+sburjan`> well when you donload the WAR, that's the platform (backend) .. and the XAR is the Enterprise part, which comes with the applications, users, etc  
00:02 <+sburjan`> \*download  
00:02 <jssolichin> has joined #xwiki  
00:02 <ries> I have limited experience with wiki's though, just CMS systems. But I do use mediawiki on my pet projects website, but xwiki has just way more features  
00:02 <+sburjan`> but if you just want to play, I recommend jetty + hsqldb package  
00:03 <+sburjan`> yes, it has a lot and it's possible to develop new ones usnig the API  
00:03 <ries> I already have glassfish and postgresql running, so it's easer for me to tun it from the war  
00:03 <+sburjan`> it's very extensible  
00:03 <+sburjan`> I see  
00:03 <+sburjan`> any particular reasons for using glassfish ?  
00:04 <ries> we have all our applications running on glassfish, and we know it mostly  
00:05 <ries> I am not much famiar with tomcat and I only know jetty by name  
00:05 <+sburjan`> well as far as I know, both are more simpler and lightwight than glassfish  
00:05 <ries> glassfish just hase a very nice administration interface :D  
00:05 <+sburjan`> ok, now I understand better :D  
00:05 <ries> haha  
00:06 <ries> we also have glassfish running, 3 clusters and 2 nodes  
00:06 <ries> it's just very easy to do that….  
00:06 <ries> properly also possible with tomcat and jetty, it's just that we never used it. Glassfish worked fine for us  
00:07 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:30 <jssolichin> has quit  
00:39 <abusenius> has quit  
01:14 <Shaddox> has quit  
02:54 <jssolichin> has joined #xwiki  
03:15 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
03:48 <ries> sdumitriu: The upload issue was indeed due to the glassfish bug, I patched glassfish and everything worked after  
03:49 <@sdumitriu> Hi ries  
03:49 <@sdumitriu> Good to hear  
04:12 <jssolichin> has quit  
04:27 <ries> sdumitriu: Tomorrow I will play with it for a half a day… see what I can do with xwiki  
05:09 <ries> To understand how the Dashboard work is that in the Administrators guide or users guide? Also, do I need a Dashboard?  
05:13 <@sdumitriu> I think users  
05:13 <@sdumitriu> And it depends on how you use your wiki  
05:14 <@sdumitriu> It's useful if you have several users and want to keep track of what's going on  
05:14 <@sdumitriu> But you can just use Main.Dashboard, you don't need to keep the homepage busy  
05:15 <@sdumitriu> Although you could invest some time into making a very good Dashboard setup useful for everybody, like a quick place to find all the useful information about the project  
05:15 <ries> Currently for example in Spaces I see 'Dashboard' and I am not sure why users need that in that list  
05:16 <@sdumitriu> Hm, yes, that one could be marked as hidden  
05:16 <ries> I tried it with permissions :) that didn't work well yet...  
05:16 <@sdumitriu> Nope, that's not good  
05:17 <@sdumitriu> In 4.1 there would be better hiding  
05:17 <@sdumitriu> In 4.0 and earlier it's harder to mark documents as hidden  
05:18 <@sdumitriu> Ah, you have to keep in mind that the Admin account sees a lot more than normal users  
05:18 <ries> I have two browsers open  
05:18 <ries> one logged in, and a other one not logged in  
05:19 <ries> in the xwiki website, shoulkd I then search for 'how to hide a space'  
05:19 <ries> or 'How to hide a page'  
05:20 <ries> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+hide+a+space+for+some+users  
05:20 <@sdumitriu> Quicker answer: edit templates/xwikivars.vm and see the $blacklistedSpaces variable  
05:21 <@sdumitriu> Right, you found it before me  
05:23 <ries> works fine for me...  
05:30 <ries> Last question for tonight..  
05:30 <ries> What is the proper why to edit 'It's an easy-to-edit website that will help you work better together.....'  
05:30 <ries> Each time I want to edit it it states that I change it for all pages  
05:31 <ries> sburjan told me to use 'Inoine Edit' but then I just see a large 'blue' area that cannot be edited  
05:31 <ries> no sorry, when I use WYSIWYG  
05:40 <@sdumitriu> That's a widget, I think it's in Main.Welcome  
05:46 <ries> But, do I type that into the URL, or is there a link that brings me there? … Just to understand..  
05:48 <@sdumitriu> Try pressing Ctrl+G  
05:50 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:53 <ries> has left #xwiki

Removed usage of maven-dependency-plugin, instead added dependency. - http://git.io/eHLPWg

11:54 <CIA-87> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r32d321e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/32d321e1850b08da3ea31aa64762c9a234600ceb / (19 files in 6 dirs): XWIKI-7649: Introduce document merge conflict resolution UI - http://git.io/wUOL\_g  
12:04 <+mflorea> guys, copying the previous release notes page when creating a new one is not the best idea..  
12:32 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <mflorea> has quit  
12:52 <vmassol> cjd: hi  
12:52 <vmassol> xwiki-commons still doesn't build :(  
12:52 <vmassol> I get:  
12:52 <vmassol> Running org.xwiki.environment.internal.ServletEnvironmentTest  
12:52 <vmassol> Tests run: 7, Failures: 2, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.577 sec <<< FAILURE!  
12:52 <vmassol> Results :  
12:52 <vmassol> Failed tests:   testGetPermanentDirectoryWhenNotSet(org.xwiki.environment.internal.ServletEnvironmentTest): expected:</var/folders/v9/\_395qc791vz23qdwyptvs06m0000gn/T/ServletEnvironmentTest-tmpDir> but was:</private/var/folders/v9/\_395qc791vz23qdwyptvs06m0000gn/T/ServletEnvironmentTest-tmpDir>  
12:52 <vmassol>   testGetTemporaryDirectoryWhenNotSet(org.xwiki.environment.internal.ServletEnvironmentTest): expected:</var/folders/v9/\_395qc791vz23qdwyptvs06m0000gn/T/ServletEnvironmentTest-tmpDir/xwiki-temp> but was:</private/var/folders/v9/\_395qc791vz23qdwyptvs06m0000gn/T/ServletEnvironmentTest-tmpDir/xwiki-temp>  
12:52 <vmassol> Tests run: 7, Failures: 2, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0  
12:53 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:57 <cjd> vmassol: thanks for letting me know, I'll take another look soon  
12:57 <vmassol> thanks  
12:59 <cjd> re WIKI-7861 I took a look at the issues which Andreas referenced and I think it makes sense to go with his solution.  
12:59 <vmassol> I haven't analysed it  
12:59 <vmassol> BUT  
12:59 <vmassol> smething must have changed causing the issue  
12:59 <vmassol> since we didn't have it before  
13:00 <cjd> I spotted it on my local machine once  
13:00 <cjd> but it was on and off which made it difficult to debug  
13:01 <cjd> and since it's unfortunately not uncommon to end up with weird issues from a broken local repo, I dismissed it at the time.  
13:03 <cjd> anyway the issues which Andreas referenced look like the same thing and they're from 2010 which makes me thing Andreas's solution makes the most sense.  
13:12 <lucaa> has quit  
13:24 <cjd> has quit  
13:25 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <nico\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <nico\_\_> is now known as <NicoD>  
13:53 <NicoD> is now known as <SubZM>  
13:54 <SubZM> anyone with knowledge of xword aka xoffice?  
13:58 <vmassol> not much…. but shoot  
14:05 <vmassol> creating contrib project for alex  
14:14 <SubZM> when i use the addon  
14:14 <SubZM> you can chose to set the server ip  
14:14 <SubZM> but when you try to save the page it gives an error  
14:15 <SubZM> i think it has to do with the addon cant save the server ip i connect to cause if i chose to view page in browser it redirects it to localhost:8080 wich is the default path of the addon  
14:17 <vmassol> hmm I don't know about this sorry. Since I don't think anyone connected here is familiar with xoffice you might want to send a mail to the xwiki users list  
14:20 <+Enygma`> yes, SubZM, send a mail to the users list and maybe you`ll get a reply from Florin, who worked on xoffice a while ago, though he might not be very active these days  
14:21 <SubZM> is there another solution to xoffice?  
14:21 <SubZM> to edit pages in word?  
14:25 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki

14:39 <@cjd> vmassol: ^want to give that a quick run just so we can make sure it's not hiding a real issue  
14:39 <vmassol> yep but otp right now  
14:40 <@cjd> ok  
14:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki
